intro: Cardaminopsis kamtschatica, commonly known as the Kamchatka buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Russia and northern China. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy flowering plants. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in a fine, white pubescence. It produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
